trademarks.name: Drone
trademarks.description: You were born to serve as a factory drone, toiling in the underground engine rooms that keep the city running. You are immensely strong and capable of working for many hours without rest.

advantages.name: I Must Work Harder
advantages.description: You may spend a Moxie point to completely clear a Dazed, Tired or Weakened Condition as a bonus Free Action.

advantages.name: Face in the Crowd
advantages.description: You look and dress like every other factory worker in the city. You can disappear into groups of drones, factory workers, or the poor with ease. You are difficult to detect until you take an action that draws attention to yourself.

advantages.name: Low-light Vision
advantages.description: You can see in dim, low-light situations as clearly as if the area was well-lit.

trademarks.name: Riffraff
trademarks.description: You grew up in the gutters of the metropolis or the shanties of Underside. Your life has been hard and has honed your survival instincts.

advantages.name: Scrounge
advantages.description: When you Rest, instead of healing, you can declare that you are looking for a specific piece of gear. Roll a D3 – if the result is higher than the item's Cost, you find it.

advantages.name: Filthy Urchins
advantages.description: You have a network of contacts who see all sorts of things from the gutter. When you try to get information or gossip from the streets of Rimside or Underside, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: In This Together
advantages.description: When you are desperate for somewhere to hide out, roll a die. On a 4 or higher, someone in Rimside or Underside will hide, shelter, or feed you. There is always a price.

trademarks.name: Skyriser
trademarks.description: You are a member of the city's elite, born into privilege and able to take advantage of all that entails. You were born to rule and raised to believe that the poor need to toil for their own benefit.

advantages.name: High Society
advantages.description: When you enter a social situation involving the wealthy and powerful, you can immediately identify who has the highest social status or most authority. Gain +1 Action Die on your first social interaction with this person.

advantages.name: Born to Rule
advantages.description: When you make Checks to bully or push around minor city officials and bureaucrats, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Lackey
advantages.description:
You have a bodyguard or personal assistant that is treated as an NPC with Grit 3 and two Tags of your choice. You may purchase gear for them with your Cred. Your Lackey is loyal but will not recklessly endanger themselves. If injured, killed, or lost in some way, you may hire a new lackey during Downtime.

Example lackeys:
- Assistant: Grit 3, Bureaucracy, Quiet
- Bodyguard: Grit 3, Brawl, Intimidate
- Chauffeur: Grit 3, Drive, Etiquette

trademarks.name: Wastelander
trademarks.description: You're not from around here. You have lived a difficult life in the harsh wastelands, the sodden swamps beneath the city, or some distant land. You are obviously out of place, but sometimes that is an advantage.

advantages.name: Obvious Outsider
advantages.description: When you behave weirdly in polite company or are caught somewhere you shouldn't be or doing something you shouldn't do, city folk are quick to believe it is because of your wild background and ignorance. Gain +1 Action Die on Checks to convince them so.

advantages.name: Stalk
advantages.description: You are an expert hunter. When you track a target, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Animal Companion
advantages.description:
You have a small, loyal pet such as a rat, raven, ferret, or cat. You may or may not be able to control the animal. The animal companion is treated as an NPC with Grit 2, the Small Tag and two other Tags of your choice. If it is killed, you suffer the Shaken Condition. You may find and train a new pet during Downtime.

Example animal companions:
- Rat: Grit 2, Small, Quiet, Bite
- Crow: Grit 2, Small, Fly, Alert
-Cat: Grit 2, Small, Climb, Silent

trademarks.name: Windborn
trademarks.description: You spent most of your life in a sky colony, perhaps as part of a nomadic airship caravan that traverses the wastes, with sky pirates, or on a floating citadel.

advantages.name: Head for Heights
advantages.description: When making Checks related to moving and working at great heights, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Ship Gunner
advantages.description: When you make an attack using a vehicle-mounted weapon, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Diplomatic Immunity
advantages.description: You hold an important position in a community outside of Tomorrow City. You can exploit this position to get out of minor misdemeanours and can roll +1 Action Die when leveraging your political credentials.

trademarks.name: Bold
trademarks.description: You are confident and courageous, with nerves of steel and a can-do attitude. The way you assess a situation, make a plan, and take action often inspires others.

advantages.name: Inspiring
advantages.description: Once per Scene, after successfully making a Check, you may spend any Boons generated to give other characters Moxie points (one for one). This cannot increase a character's Moxie point total beyond their starting maximum. You cannot inspire yourself.

advantages.name: Steely
advantages.description: When you resist something frightening or intimidating, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Into the Breach
advantages.description: If an ally fails or Botches an attack, you can use your next action to attack the same target with +1 Action Die.

trademarks.name: Broken
trademarks.description: You were injured and disfigured, perhaps during The Long War, or maybe in a factory accident. Technicians and surgeons put you back together as best they could, but you are a jigsaw of machine and flesh now.

advantages.name: Mostly Machine
advantages.description: You can last twice as long without food, water, or oxygen as a normal human can, and are immune to the Poisoned Condition. You recover Damage during rests as normal but cannot benefit from healing. A repair Check can be made to heal Hits or remove Damage from Injuries, in the same way that someone else might receive first aid.

advantages.name: Part-Automaton
advantages.description: You can sense the signals from automatons and can make a Check to gain an impression of their surface-level 'thoughts' (usually their current attitude, mood, or intent).

advantages.name: Auxiliary Limb
advantages.description: You have either an extra mechanical limb or a detachable hand (choose when you select this Advantage). The extra limb is an arm or tail that ends in a claw that can grip and hold things but cannot attack or perform precise actions. The detachable hand works like a Tiny, Simple robot. You may select this Advantage a second time, taking the alternate option.

trademarks.name: Caring
trademarks.description: You are incredibly empathetic and seek to ease the suffering of others. You often give freely of whatever resources you have and look out for those who cannot help themselves.
flaws: I Will Not Harm a Helpless Person

advantages.name: Rally
advantages.description: Once per Scene, you can use a Quick Action to clear a psychological Condition, such as Angry, Shaken, or Dazed, from another character who can see or hear you. You can spend Moxie to rally additional characters (one-for-one) or to clear additional Conditions at the same time. You cannot rally yourself.

advantages.name: A Little Kindness
advantages.description: When you tend to an ally during a Rest, they can remove one additional point of Damage from a single Injury.

advantages.name: Calm Under Pressure
advantages.description: Spend a point of Moxie after you make a Check to negate any Pressure generated by the roll.

trademarks.name: Charming
trademarks.description: You have an easy charm that draws others in and makes them feel at ease. You have a knack for making suggestions that others find reasonable and tend to get your own way.
flaws: Caught Up in Your Own Charm

advantages.name: Dreamy
advantages.description: If you take time to listen to, study, or investigate a target you can adjust your demeanour and appearance to make yourself very appealing to them. Gain +1 Action Die when interacting with the target in social situations until they see through your subterfuge or you cause them harm (physically or emotionally).

advantages.name: Winning Smile
advantages.description: When you attempt to persuade someone with your charm and magnetism, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Orator
advantages.description: You can easily draw a crowd and hold their attention for a short period. While you are speaking to them, they will remain focused on you, unless something loud, dangerous, or disruptive occurs.

trademarks.name: Genius
trademarks.description: You are incredibly intelligent, well-educated, or wise from life experiences. You have an uncanny ability to retain information and solve problems that others cannot.

advantages.name: Academic Rigour
advantages.description: When you research information or call on academic knowledge, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Mastermind
advantages.description: If you carefully make a plan, spend time preparing, and explain it in detail, any ally who follows through gains Mastery on a single non-combat Check related to the execution of the plan.

advantages.name: Tactician
advantages.description: If you spend a Quick Action assessing a situation and telling an ally exactly where to shoot or how to hit a target, they gain +1 Action Die on their next attack Check.

trademarks.name: Huge
trademarks.description: You are big, muscular, and very strong. You can easily lift great weights and regularly engage in physically demanding tasks. While you are tough and strong, you are sometimes not the most graceful of individuals.

advantages.name: Heavy Lifter
advantages.description: You may ignore the Cumbersome Tag on one item of gear you carry.

advantages.name: Iron Sinews
advantages.description: When performing feats of strength, such as lifting or breaking items, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Diehard
advantages.description: Your size and natural constitution make you hard to bring down. You may suffer one additional Injury than your Grit would normally allow.

trademarks.name: Perceptive
trademarks.description: You notice things that others miss and often have uncanny insights into situations or people. You focus on details, put the pieces together, and always seem to spot vital clues.

advantages.name: Simple Deduction
advantages.description: When you spend some time observing and analysing a target, you can accurately determine which part of the city they have recently been in and gain a helpful insight about their past, habits, or recent activity.

advantages.name: Detail-Oriented
advantages.description: When you make Checks to spot, notice, or search, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Danger Sense
advantages.description: You are never surprised at the start of combat and may instead roll for Initiative as normal.

trademarks.name: Quick
trademarks.description: You are quick on your feet, fit, and nimble. You act with speed and agility and have excellent hand-eye coordination.

advantages.name: Parkour
advantages.description: When you make Checks to run, leap, or climb, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Counterstrike
advantages.description: When you successfully avoid Harm from a close combat attack, you can spend any Boons generated to inflict 1 Damage on your attacker. You can also spend Moxie to inflict additional Damage, one for one.

advantages.name: Quick Hands
advantages.description: You can make two Free Actions each Turn.

trademarks.name: Sneaky
trademarks.description: You are sly and devious by nature, getting by in life with half-truths, stealth, and deception. You have a talent for going unnoticed, tricking others, or getting into places you otherwise shouldn't be able to.

advantages.name: One With Shadows
advantages.description: Whether by natural talent or an affinity with the Pattern, you become virtually undetectable when you remain perfectly still in the shadows, even to mechanical aids such as night-vision goggles and infrared cameras.

advantages.name: Natural Born Liar
advantages.description: When you lie to or deceive someone, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Sneak Attack
advantages.description: When you attempt a Take-Down on an unaware target, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Tainted
trademarks.description: Exposure to radium, serums, or other chemicals has left you permanently changed. This might be subtle, or could manifest as horrible boils, glowing eyes, or dark pulsing veins.

advantages.name: Toxin Resistance
advantages.description: You can spend a Moxie point to clear the Poisoned Condition as a Free Action. In addition, serum side effects with a random duration last half as long as usual (rounding down).

advantages.name: Toxic Blood
advantages.description: Your blood is either acidic or poisonous (choose when you take this Advantage). You can suffer 1 Damage to draw a vial of blood to use as a tool. Anything that bites you suffers 1 Damage.

advantages.name: Mutation
advantages.description:
You have one of the following obvious physical mutations that grants you a bonus Action Die when appropriate:
- Cat's Eyes: You have excellent night vision.
- Gills: You can breathe under water.
- Huge Ears: You have excellent hearing.
- Scorched Skin: You have the Resistance (Fire) Tag.

trademarks.name: Apothecary
trademarks.description: Part doctor, part alchemist, you are an expert at making serums, tinctures, and salves that enhance a user's skills or abilities. You work the streets or from hidden laboratories, dispensing aid to whoever needs it.

advantages.name: Fully Stocked
advantages.description: You begin a Job with a number of free Serum Spikers equal to your starting Cred. Each is fully stocked with serums.

advantages.name: Brewmeister
advantages.description: During a Rest, or when you have time to work, you can attempt to brew up a specific serum, poison, acid, or similar product. The Danger Rating is equal to the Cost of the chosen serum or tool, and can be further modified by circumstances as normal. A successful Check creates D3 doses. Boons can increase the total doses by +1, or may have other effects.

advantages.name: Combat Medic
advantages.description: When you heal yourself or someone else, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Aviator
trademarks.description: You're a pilot, airman, or dirigible sailor. As a veteran of air combat and a bold aviator, you are at home soaring through the skies in anything that can get you there.

advantages.name: Aircraft
advantages.description: You own (or have access to) a Cost 3 dirigible or aircraft, such as a Sky Cab or Stormwind Fighter. If this is damaged or destroyed, you can repair or replace it during Downtime. You may select this Advantage a second time, increasing the value of your personal craft to Cost 5.

advantages.name: Dogfighter
advantages.description: When you make a Manoeuvre Check during dogfights, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Brace! Brace! Brace!
advantages.description: You always have time to bail out from a damaged or destroyed vehicle. In addition, when you do, you can spend a Moxie point to survive completely unscathed – tell everyone how you managed this!

trademarks.name: Crook
trademarks.description: You are a grifter, thief, or petty criminal, skilled at breaking the law to achieve your goals. You deal in the illicit and have probably been locked up at least once.
flaws: Wanted by the Ministry of Peace
Brand (or other mark of a criminal)

advantages.name: Expert Entry
advantages.description: When you make a Check to pick locks, override security, or break and enter, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Easy Mark
advantages.description: If you have time to observe a target, their habits, and their routines, you can learn a secret or weakness. Gain +1 Action Die when exploiting this weakness.

advantages.name: Rogue's Gallery
advantages.description: You have met, worked with, and maybe informed on a lot of bad guys. When you encounter a new villain or criminal, you may declare that you have history with them. The GM decides what that history is and how they feel about you.

trademarks.name: Engineer
trademarks.description: You are a mechanic, grease monkey, demolitions expert, or roughneck responsible for maintaining and repairing city infrastructure, airship engines, or other large machinery.

advantages.name: Grease Monkey
advantages.description: When you attempt to repair or disable vehicles and machines, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Wreck It
advantages.description: When you use a Focused Action to attack a vehicle, robot, or automaton, a successful Check deals +1 Damage.

advantages.name: Demolitionist
advantages.description: When using an explosive, you can spend a Moxie point to add one of the following Tags to it: Anti-Material, Electro, Fire, Huge Blast, Radio Detonator, Stun, or Timer.

trademarks.name: Gadgeteer
trademarks.description: Part scientist, part engineer, you are a natural at building, repairing, and inventing things. There isn't a machine you can't fix or a problem you cannot solve with a little time and a custom-built gadget.

advantages.name: Inventor
advantages.description: When you have the time and space to work, and materials to work with, you can build weapons, tools, or new devices. This requires a Check with a base Danger Rating equal to the gear's Cost. Boons can add more Tags or reduce the build time. A particular success might mean the gadget is free or has a negative Tag, such as Unreliable, One Use, or Dangerous. The base construction time is one hour per point of Cost (so a Cost 2 item will require at least two hours to build).

advantages.name: Gadgets
advantages.description: As a Free Action, you can spend a Moxie point to declare you have a small, useful item of gear with up to one Tag. The item rarely lasts for long.

advantages.name: Bot Builder
advantages.description: You begin with a single free robot (with 1 Tag: Small or Utility) with a Cost equal to your Cred +1. Robots you purchase cost 1 Cred less (to a minimum of 1).

trademarks.name: Gargoyle
trademarks.description: You are a vigilante and defender of the weak, haunting the night on the prowl for trouble. You mete out justice where there might otherwise be none.

advantages.name: Mask
advantages.description:
You wear a frightening Gargoyle Mask. If lost or broken, you can spend a Moxie point during a Rest to repair or replace it.

- Gargoyle Mask: Night Vision, Intimidating, Immunity (Gas)

advantages.name: Whirlwind Attack
advantages.description: You never suffer a penalty for being outnumbered in close combat. In addition, when fighting Mooks in close combat, gain +1 Action Die.

advantages.name: Fear Itself
advantages.description: When you make a Check to intimidate or frighten someone, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Gumshoe
trademarks.description: You dig the dirt, find the clues, and seek answers to things that some people would prefer you left alone. You are a private investigator and troubleshooter.

advantages.name: Just One More Thing
advantages.description: When you seek information by questioning or interrogating someone, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Tarnished Badge
advantages.description: You have close ties to or a helpful contact in the Badges. You can leverage this relationship to learn a piece of inside information, look at reports, get into crime scenes, or even speak to prisoners. There may be a price to pay.

advantages.name: Hardboiled
advantages.description: You're tough as old boots. You can spend a Moxie point to ignore the effects of a single Injury for the remainder of a Scene.

trademarks.name: Muckraker
trademarks.description: You're a reporter, agitator, or neighborhood gossip. You sway opinion, reveal unwanted truths, and inform on current events by digging-up evidence.
traits: Keeps an Eye on the Telecreens
Knows the Ministry of Truth's Tricks
flaws: Wanted by the Ministry of Truth

advantages.name: Cam-bot
advantages.description:
You have a small spider-legged robot with a camera that can record or project up to 60 seconds of footage (no sound) or send a live signal back to a connected telescreen. If lost or broken, it can be replaced or repaired during Downtime.

- Cam-bot: Small Typical robot (p.117), Record, Project, Climb.

advantages.name: Rumour Mill
advantages.description: When you have time to Rest, you can spread rumours, gossip, and lies instead of healing. On a successful Check, people in a nominated neighborhood believe this information. Boons can increase the number of neighborhoods influenced.

advantages.name: People Reader
advantages.description: When you attempt to determine if a target is lying or their attitude or motivations, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Scrapper
trademarks.description: You're a professional fighter, making your living with your fists. You take work where you can get it, competing in the underground fight circuits, bodyguarding the rich and powerful, or doing dirty jobs for dangerous people.

advantages.name: Thumpers
advantages.description:
You are equipped with diesel-powered fighting fists known as Thumpers. If the Thumpers are lost or destroyed, you can repair or replace them during Downtime.

- Thumpers: Powerful, Parry, Demolish Stuff. Choose one of the following Tags for free: Deadly, Electro, Fractal (and Rare), Rapid Fire, or Stun (and Non-Lethal).

advantages.name: Assess An Enemy
advantages.description: If you spend a Focused Action watching a living opponent, you can identify a weak spot. You roll with Mastery on close combat attacks made against them for the remainder of the Scene or until you assess a new target.

advantages.name: Brawler
advantages.description: When engaged in close combat, you can spend a Moxie Point to make one bonus attack Action in a Turn.

trademarks.name: Sharpshooter
trademarks.description: You are a gunslinger, sniper, or trick shooter. You are familiar with all manner of firearms and can hit a target at a hundred paces while blindfolded.

advantages.name: Special Ammo
advantages.description: You may spend a Moxie point to load a ranged weapon with special ammo. This lets you add one of the following Tags to the weapon: Accurate, Deadly, Stun, Electro, or Fire. The special ammo lasts until the Scene ends. You decide to load a different special ammo, or you Botch a roll with the weapon.

advantages.name: Ricochet
advantages.description: When making a shooting attack, you may bounce a projectile off hard surfaces. Add +1 Danger Die for each surface you bounce off.

advantages.name: Guns Akimbo
advantages.description: When you shoot with two pistols at the same time, roll with +1 Action Die and deal +1 Damage on a successful attack.

trademarks.name: Sky Ranger
trademarks.description: You are or were a member of the Sky Ranger Corps; elite warriors who literally flew into the action. You utilise shock and awe to overcome enemies and diffuse situations before they can escalate further.

advantages.name: Rocket Pack
advantages.description:
You are equipped with a sophisticated rocket pack. If it is lost or damaged, you can repair or replace it during Downtime.

- Rocket Pack: Fly, Fast, Agile, Noisy.

advantages.name: Dynamic Entry
advantages.description: When you enter a room, vehicle, or aircraft with force, any enemies present count as surprised for the first Turn of combat.

advantages.name: The High Ground
advantages.description: When you attack a target from above, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Veteran
trademarks.description: You saw action during The Long War, probably posted to the front, and bore witness to unspeakable horrors. You are a seasoned soldier and weary veteran.

advantages.name: Trench Life
advantages.description: Used to catching some shut eye wherever you can, you gain the benefits of a Rest in just three hours.

advantages.name: Serum Soldier
advantages.description: Soldiers were encouraged to take whatever they had to keep them in fighting condition. Increase the duration of serum effects by +1. Side effect duration is not altered. In addition, you begin each Job with one free Serum Spiker filled with serums.

advantages.name: Armour Optimisation
advantages.description: At the start of a Mission, after you gear up, you may add one of the following Tags to a piece of armour you are equipped with: Resistant (Fire), Resistant (Electro), Immune (Gas), +1 Armour. You may select this Advantage up to three times.

trademarks.name: Aberration Tracer
trademarks.description: Part bounty hunter, part killer, you are committed to hunting down and destroying manifestations of the Pattern. You have honed your skills to track and destroy, particularly aberrations and dangerous Pattern users.

advantages.name: Fractal Blade
advantages.description:
You can manifest a blade of Pattern energy with a thought, as a Free Action. Taking this Advantage a second time allows you to spend a Moxie point to give a weapon you can see the Fractal Tag for the remainder of the scene.

- Fractal Blade: Parry, Fractal, Powerful, Concealed.

advantages.name: Barren
advantages.description: You can make a Check to create a field where Pattern energy is suppressed. A success creates a field out to Close range around you, and Boons can increase its size or have other effects. Aberrations in the barren field reduce their Danger Rating by one. The field requires a Free Action to maintain each Turn.

advantages.name: Pattern Tracing
advantages.description: When you make a Check to detect the Pattern, follow the trail of Aberrations, or navigate areas warped by the Pattern, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Metaphysical Geometrist
trademarks.description: You have explored the city and uncovered the secret paths of the Pattern as it flows through the mortar of buildings, or the spaces between lamp posts. You have learned to move and interact with the world in seemingly impossible ways.

advantages.name: Destination Anywhere
advantages.description: Before you open a door, you can declare it leads to a room, hallway, or other space familiar to you. The destination must have a door you can enter through. On a successful Check, you are correct and, while the door remains open, you (and others) can step between the locations, no matter the distance between them. Less familiar destinations and places far away are harder to connect.

advantages.name: Tesseract
advantages.description: With a thought, you can open a trans-dimensional space about the size of a small safe or lockbox. You can store and retrieve small items from the tesseract as necessary. Whenever you retrieve an item, roll a D6; on a 1, the space also exits the box. Anything stored in the tesseract exists out of time and space and does not decay or grow old. You may select this Advantage a second time, increasing the size of the tesseract to that of a small closet.

advantages.name: Four-dimensional Vision
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point to see through the walls of buildings as if you had X-Ray vision. Lasts for up to 1 minute.

trademarks.name: Symbolist
trademarks.description: You have learned to manipulate the Pattern through symbols, images, and writing, forcing it to your will. You use these skills to fashion glyphs and marks that benefit or harm others, to change the way objects work, and to interpret symbols and writing.

advantages.name: Glyph
advantages.description: You draw a complex symbol on an item of gear or other object, imbuing it with a little Pattern energy. On a successful Check, the item gains one Tag of your choice which will last for up to one Scene. Boons can add more Tags, increase the duration, or have other effects. Tags can be any descriptive effect (such as Locked, Strong, Weakened, Glowing, etc.) or an actual gear Tag.

advantages.name: Symbol of Protection
advantages.description: You can use a Free Action to draw a shield of Pattern energy, granting you one of the following Tags until the beginning of your next Turn: Deflect, Parry, Resistant (Fire), Resistant (Electro). You may spend Moxie to apply additional Tags, one-for-one.

advantages.name: Fabricated Image
advantages.description: You can make a Check to draw an image of an inanimate object on a wall, floor, or other surface. On a success, the drawing takes on a realistic appearance, good enough to pass a cursory glance. Boons can be used to improve the detail or realism, while partial successes indicate the drawing took a long time or has some obvious flaw. The illusion lasts until interacted with or inspected closely.

trademarks.name: Weird
trademarks.description: You have a strange affinity with the Pattern and the way it flows around and between people. This gives you uncanny insight into the actions of others but often makes you seem different from the world around you.

advantages.name: Jinx
advantages.description: If you have no Moxie points, you may gain one when another player's Check creates Pressure.

advantages.name: Pattern Reading
advantages.description: As a Focused Action, you can make a Check to see and read the Pattern as it flows around a living target. On a success, you gain insight into their current mood, motivations, attitude, or intentions. This knowledge comes to you as impressions of colour, shapes, and feelings and better rolls reveal clearer information.

advantages.name: Phase Imp
advantages.description: You have bonded to an impulsive and chaotic aberration, no larger than your hand. The imp has animal intelligence, Grit 2 and one Tag from the following list: Distracting, Fast, Fly, Impossibly Thin, Sharp Edges, Tough. If you concentrate, you can see through the imp's eyes, but it doesn't like it. If the imp dies you suffer the Weakened Condition. You may summon and bond with a new imp during Downtime.

trademarks.name: Academic
trademarks.description: You spent your life with your nose buried in books, working as a librarian, teacher, or research assistant. Perhaps you've been published. In Hard City, your knowledge might be the only light in a city steeped in shadows, but your naivety could also be your downfall.

advantages.name: Peerless Deduction
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point to instantly connect clues, solve puzzles, or deduce the next logical step in a mystery. Gain narrative insight or eliminate uncertainty in investigations.

advantages.name: Arcane Scholar
advantages.description: Your deep studies include the occult and forbidden knowledge. You can recognize strange symbols, comprehend unusual texts, or identify supernatural phenomena. Gain a bonus when dealing with mysteries beyond the mundane.

advantages.name: Prepared for Anything
advantages.description: You always seem to have the right book, note, or obscure fact for the situation. Once per session, spend a Moxie point to produce a key piece of information or a vital clue that helps the group.

trademarks.name: Bureaucrat
trademarks.description: You were a paper-pusher, knowledgeable in how public and private business runs. You may have been a politician, clerk, business owner, secretary, or office manager.

advantages.name: Grease the Wheels
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point to bypass bureaucratic red tape, obtain a permit, or cut through procedural delays instantly.

advantages.name: Friends in High Places
advantages.description: You can call in favors from well-placed contacts in government or business, gaining information or access to restricted areas.

advantages.name: Leverage
advantages.description: You always seem to have dirt on someone. When you attempt to blackmail or coerce someone into compliance, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Button Man
trademarks.description: You killed people for money, fun, or out of loyalty to a person, organisation, or cause. You were a hitman or professional killer.

advantages.name: Disappear into the Shadows
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point to vanish from the scene, avoiding pursuit or detection in low-light or chaotic environments.

advantages.name: Intimidating Presence
advantages.description: Your cold demeanor and reputation precede you. Wwhen coercing or scaring others into submission, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Professional Precision

advantages.name: Social Chameleon

trademarks.name: Defender

trademarks.name: Enforcer

advantages.name: Fear Factor

advantages.name: Professional Violence

trademarks.name: Investigator

advantages.name: Follow the Money

advantages.description: You can move through swamp, mud, or overgrown terrain without penalty. You can also hold your breath for an extended time and swim silently when undisturbed.

advantages.name: Swamp Traps
advantages.description: During a Rest, you may prepare up to 2 simple traps. Spend a Moxie to trigger one at a key moment—immobilizing, disorienting, or distracting a foe.

advantages.name: Bog Ghost
advantages.description: When you Hide or attempt to escape pursuit in natural terrain, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Patchwork Cyborg
trademarks.description: Your body remembers the weight of chains and circuit-welders. Altered and augmented by the regime, your cyber-claw is both curse and tool. You've reclaimed your metal as your own—but it still hums with ghosts.

advantages.name: Cyber Claw Utility
advantages.description: Your claw can function as a grappling hook, cutting torch, or blunt-force tool. Once per scene, you may perform an otherwise impossible mechanical task (e.g., tear through metal, punch through a wall).

advantages.name: Glitch Surge
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point to ignore all Conditions affecting you for one Turn, as your systems override pain and fatigue.

advantages.name: Reclaimed Tech
advantages.description: You may make a Check to disable or hijack old Horde technology, gaining insight or limited control if successful.

trademarks.name: Trickster Scout
trademarks.description: You run where others slog, climb where others stumble, and laugh where others curse. You're a saboteur, scout, and mischief-maker for the rebellion—unpredictable, indispensable, and probably climbing something right now.

advantages.name: Dirty Tricks
advantages.description: When you fight an unaware or distracted enemy, deal +1 Damage and gain +1 Action Die on the attack.

advantages.name: Vanishing Act
advantages.description: Once per scene, when outnumbered or surrounded, spend a Moxie point to escape, vanish, or reappear from an unexpected angle.

advantages.name: Improvised Sabotage
advantages.description: During a scene, you can declare that you rigged or tampered with a nearby mechanism earlier. Spend a Moxie to trigger a minor explosion, disable a system, or force an unexpected malfunction.

trademarks.name: Shadowless Thief
trademarks.description: You slip between the cracks where light dares not follow.

advantages.name: Vanishing Act
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point when you make a successful Move or Dodge Check during a chase to immediately vanish from sight, avoiding all pursuit. You can only use this once per Scene.

advantages.name: Still Hands
advantages.description: When you make a Check requiring precise handwork — such as picking locks, sleight of hand, or pickpocketing — roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Absorb Locks
advantages.description: Once per Scene, you can absorb and permanently jam a simple mechanical lock (such as a door or padlock) by touching it and focusing. The lock becomes unusable without being broken or magically repaired.

trademarks.name: Hollow Vessel
trademarks.description: The emptiness inside is both your curse and your strength.

advantages.name: Empty Chest
advantages.description: You can smuggle large or fragile items inside your hollow frame. You suffer no penalties for carrying concealed cargo unless searched by supernatural means.

advantages.name: Whisper Breather
advantages.description: You can breathe so quietly that you are undetectable by any sense of hearing, even enhanced senses. This affects only hearing-based detection.

advantages.name: Resonant Strike
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point when you succeed on a close-combat attack to unbalance your target. The target becomes Dazed until the end of their next Turn.

trademarks.name: Reflection Taker
trademarks.description: Mirrors are weapons, and faces are currency.

advantages.name: Mirrortrap
advantages.description: Once per Scene, when you interact with a target via any reflective surface (mirror, water, polished metal), you may spend 1 Moxie to destabilize their reflection. Until the end of the Scene, the GM may impose penalties on their Awareness, Movement, or Coordination.

advantages.name: False Image
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to create a brief illusory double nearby. It lasts until touched, attacked, or revealed by an opposed Awareness Check.

advantages.name: Face Stealer
advantages.description: Once per Scene, after observing a target's reflection closely, you may mimic their face, voice, and mannerisms for the rest of the Scene. No Check is required unless closely scrutinized.

trademarks.name: Inkweaver Surgeon
trademarks.description: Your hands rewrite the body, and your tattoos tell living tales.

advantages.name: Living Bandages
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to instantly stabilize a wounded ally at Near range by animating your enchanted bandages. This prevents Bleeding Out or escalating Conditions, but does not restore Health.

advantages.name: Gift the Pain
advantages.description: When you make a successful close-combat touch attack, you may spend 1 Moxie to transfer an injury or Condition you have absorbed onto the target. The target suffers the same effect until healed.

advantages.name: Wound Reader
advantages.description: When you study a person's scars or injuries up close, you may ask the GM one question about their past, vulnerabilities, or hidden weaknesses without requiring a roll.

trademarks.name: Echo-Seer
trademarks.description: You see not the flesh—but the echoes of every pain it has endured.

advantages.name: Memory Echo
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to replay the strongest emotional imprint left behind in a location or object. You may ask the GM one question about what occurred here recently — focusing on trauma, betrayal, or sudden violence.

advantages.name: Aura Flare
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to unleash a psychic surge of suffering. All enemies within Near range must succeed on a Will or Resolve Check or suffer the Dazed Condition until the end of their next Turn.

advantages.name: Phantom Companion
advantages.description: Once per session, you may call on the aid of a lingering ghost you once healed. The GM will grant you a small favor — such as a warning, distraction, or minor environmental manipulation.

trademarks.name: Cursed Healer
trademarks.description: To save a life is to take on a piece of its destiny.

advantages.name: Borrowed Talents
advantages.description: Once per session, after healing someone, you may access one of their Skills or Traits for the rest of the Scene. The GM will approve or suggest an appropriate ability based on the healed character.

advantages.name: Shared Burden
advantages.description: When an ally within Near range would take Damage, you may spend 1 Moxie to absorb half the Damage yourself (rounded up). You must be aware of the attack and capable of reaching them.

advantages.name: Destiny Scar
advantages.description: When you heal a target, you may mark them with a faint scar of fate. Until the end of the next day, you can sense their general well-being (healthy, wounded, dying) and rough direction regardless of distance.

trademarks.name: Scholar of the Wilds
trademarks.description: You seek truth in the curling roots and whispering stones.

advantages.name: Toxic Intuition
advantages.description: You can instinctively sense whether a creature, object, or environment is poisonous or toxic without tasting or direct exposure. No Moxie spend.

advantages.name: Echoes of the Old World
advantages.description: When studying ruins, spirit sites, or ancient trails, you may ask the GM one question about its builders, purpose, or history without requiring a Check. Once per scene.

advantages.name: Wilderness Tactician
advantages.description: When setting an ambush, navigating traps, or preparing defenses in natural terrain, roll with Mastery.

trademarks.name: Apprentice of the Grove
trademarks.description: The Great Forest speaks to you—softly, but insistently.

advantages.name: Nature's Remedy
advantages.description: During a Rest, you may prepare one minor curative: a basic salve, antidote, stimulant, or painkiller. At any time, you may spend 1 Moxie to rapidly concoct one such item without resting.

advantages.name: Beast Whisperer
advantages.description: When attempting to calm, guide, or hide among natural animals, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Nature's Favor
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to subtly call upon the natural world for aid. Nearby plants, creatures, or elements intervene on your behalf—blocking attacks, opening paths, causing distractions, or warning of unseen threats. The GM describes how nature responds.

trademarks.name: Seeker of Hidden Truths
trademarks.description: Nothing in nature hides from your curious heart.

advantages.name: Keen-Nosed
advantages.description: When tracking a person, beast, or magical trail, you can roll with Mastery if you have a clear scent, trace, or environmental residue to follow.

advantages.name: Divinatory Hunch
advantages.description: Once per scene, you may ask the GM for a "gut feeling" insight related to a mystery, hidden threat, or unknown danger. The GM must give a truthful but cryptic answer.

advantages.name: Trapwright
advantages.description: When you take time to carefully study a trap, alarm, or sabotage device, you automatically find a safe method to disable it without requiring a Check.

trademarks.name: Vow of Mercy
trademarks.description: Your hands are weapons of war—and pledges of healing.

advantages.name: Mercy in Motion
advantages.description: When fighting to subdue rather than kill, you gain +1 Action Die on close combat attacks against targets who are actively resisting.

advantages.name: Shield of Conviction
advantages.description: You roll with Mastery on Willpower Checks made to resist mental influence or emotional corruption.

advantages.name: Confessor's Voice
advantages.description: You gain +1 Action Die when trying to compel guilt-ridden or doubting NPCs to hesitate, confess, or reveal hidden fears.

trademarks.name: Verdant Knight
trademarks.description: Sworn defender of the green sanctum; your blade is the will of the wild.

advantages.name: Rooted Stance
advantages.description: While standing still and not Dodging, you gain +1 Resistance Die against knockback or shove effects.

advantages.name: Living Shield
advantages.description: Once per turn, when you would take Damage from a physical attack, you may spend 1 Moxie to negate the Damage completely.

advantages.name: Command the Verdant Host
advantages.description: Once per scene, rally nearby allies; all allies within Near range gain +1 Action Die on their next action.

trademarks.name: Grove's Chosen
trademarks.description: The sentient forest has marked you as its emissary.

advantages.name: Spirits' Whisper
advantages.description: Gain +1 Action Die when making Checks to track, scout, or locate hidden things in natural terrain.

advantages.name: Living Touch
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to remove a Minor Condition (e.g., Fatigue, Bleeding) from a creature or ally.

advantages.name: Summon Small Beasts
advantages.description: Once per scene, summon a swarm of woodland creatures. They can inflict the Hindered Condition or create a distraction (GM's choice).

trademarks.name: Street Mage
trademarks.description: You learned magic in alleyways and backrooms, from smugglers, cults, and grimoires traded for blood. Your spells are dirty, fast, and effective — magic as survival, not scholarship.
gear: Chalk Circle burned into a piece of cardboard
Empty vials smelling faintly of ozone

advantages.name: Arcane Backlash
advantages.description: When you suffer a physical attack, you may spend 1 Moxie to lash out instinctively with raw magical energy. Your attacker suffers 1 Damage as a burst of fire, static, or force explodes from your aura.

advantages.name: Battle Mage
advantages.description: When casting a spell while directly threatened in combat, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Ritual Cache
advantages.description: Once per Job, you may spend 1 Moxie to declare you prepared a ritual beforehand that grants 1 temporary magical Tag (e.g., Barrier, Concealed, Fire) to a chosen object or location.

trademarks.name: Astral Perception
trademarks.description: You see the astral plane like others see graffiti — everywhere, layered across the world. The colors of souls, the stench of spells, the burn of Pattern scars: you can’t turn it off, and sometimes, it sees you back.
gear: Salt ring in a bottle cap
Fingertip gloves (to avoid touching too much)

advantages.name: Astral Projection
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point to leave your body and scout in the astral plane. You gain +1 Action Die on Checks to detect wards, spirits, or magical threats.

advantages.name: Second Sight
advantages.description: You can sense the presence and shape of nearby active magic, even through solid objects—but only for moments at a time.

advantages.name: Spirit Echo
advantages.description: When in a place where death or intense magic occurred, you may make a Check to witness a lingering astral impression of the event. On a success, you learn a hidden detail about what occurred.

trademarks.name: Forgotten Adept
trademarks.description: You weren’t trained in a tower or taught by mentors. You found fragments in burned books and half-finished tattoos. Your magic is pieced together, practical, and powered by raw intent more than tradition.
flaws: Bound to a Spirit That Sometimes Talks Back

advantages.name: Old Knowledge
advantages.description: Roll with Mastery when deciphering arcane texts, ancient glyphs, or forgotten rituals.

advantages.name: Patchwork Magic
advantages.description: When casting without proper components or under duress, you may spend 1 Moxie to ignore penalties for being unprepared.

advantages.name: Jury-Rigged Ritual
advantages.description: During a Rest, you may construct a simple magical ward or effect using junk and salvage. On a success, the ritual works with one Tag (GM decides specifics).

trademarks.name: Household Enchantress
trademarks.description: You wield ancient magic not for conquest or command, but to make a home shimmer with joy, sensuality, and secret power. Your spells tidy rooms, conjure feasts, or smite intruders — all in the name of domestic bliss.
gear: Corked bottle now used as a jewelry holder
Floating serving tray shaped like a lotus flower

advantages.name: Blink!
advantages.description: Once per Scene, you may instantly teleport yourself and one object or willing person within Close range to a different location within your line of sight.

advantages.name: Magical Housework
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point to instantly clean, decorate, repair, or enchant a room or home space. The effect is vivid, sensory, and lasts for the rest of the Scene.

advantages.name: Defend the Hearth
advantages.description: When someone threatens your home or loved ones, roll with Mastery on magical attacks or defenses made in that location.

trademarks.name: Boundless Romantic
trademarks.description: You love with your entire being — fierce, radiant, sometimes too much. Emotion fuels your magic, and your desire to be cherished gives you strength beyond reason.
gear: Perfume that smells like roses and lightning

advantages.name: Lovestruck Surge
advantages.description: When defending or assisting a person you love, spend a Moxie point to add +2 Action Dice to your next magical or social Check.

advantages.name: Heated Emotion
advantages.description: If you suffer the Angry, Dazed, or Shaken Condition due to emotional stress, you may immediately clear it by triggering a burst of chaotic magic — something nearby breaks, floats, or transforms unexpectedly.

advantages.name: Magnetic Aura
advantages.description: When entering a social scene, you may choose one character who is immediately drawn to you. Until you harm or ignore them, you gain +1 Action Die when interacting with them.

trademarks.name: Bottlebound Past
trademarks.description: You were once bound to a bottle, passed between masters, unseen and unfree. Though that time has passed, the echoes of enchantment and obedience haunt you — and the ancient powers it granted still linger.
gear: The bottle that once imprisoned you
Scroll of names you’ve tried to forget

advantages.name: Wish Echo
advantages.description: Once per Job, you may grant a 'small wish' — a single miraculous effect (such as mending, revealing, or beautifying) with no cost. It must benefit someone other than you and comes with a haunting whisper from your past.

advantages.name: Residual Obedience
advantages.description: When given a direct, politely phrased command, you must make a Willpower Check to resist it. On a success, you may ignore it and gain 1 Moxie for overcoming your conditioning.

advantages.name: Unsealed Power
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie point to remove one magical limitation for the rest of the Scene — such as range, visibility, or needing a verbal component. The effect is dramatic, but leaves you momentarily stunned at the end.

trademarks.name: Fixer-at-Heart
trademarks.description: You don’t wear a badge or wield a wand, but when things break—physically or emotionally—you’re the one who shows up. Whether it’s a busted pipe, a friend in crisis, or a looming supernatural threat, you get your hands dirty and make it right.
gear: Notebook of practical spells he can’t use
Set of lifting chalk, wrist wraps, and gloves

advantages.name: Grounded in Chaos
advantages.description: When everything is falling apart—socially, emotionally, or magically—you may spend 1 Moxie to clear the Dazed or Shaken Condition from yourself or an ally within sight. You must say something honest first.

advantages.name: Fix the Damn Thing
advantages.description: Roll with Mastery when repairing broken items, systems, or infrastructure under pressure.

advantages.name: Solid Presence
advantages.description: Once per Scene, you may anchor a conversation or scene by speaking plainly and decisively. Choose one person—until the end of the Scene, they cannot lie to you without suffering Pressure.

trademarks.name: Steady Soul
trademarks.description: You are the calm in someone else’s storm. People lean on you—not because you're loud, but because you're still standing when no one else is. Emotionally mature, physically rooted, you weather whatever comes.
gear: Coffee mug with a chip in the handle

advantages.name: Quiet Strength
advantages.description: When resisting manipulation, supernatural charm, or mental interference, roll with Mastery. You always know when someone is trying to 'push' you emotionally.

advantages.name: Emotional Center
advantages.description: Once per Scene, you may speak plainly to someone and remove a psychological Condition from them (e.g., Angry, Shaken). If you touch them while doing so, you both gain 1 Moxie.

advantages.name: Just a Look
advantages.description: Choose a person you've protected or helped. For the rest of the Scene, you can interrupt any social interaction involving them with a word or look that grants them +1 Action Die (limit once per Turn).

trademarks.name: Fractured Lineage
trademarks.description: You thought you were normal—but something in your blood pulls toward the Pattern. Whether it’s latent power, an old curse, or a forgotten inheritance, your body remembers things your mind can’t. The truth is surfacing, and it scares you more than it should.
flaws: Afraid of What He Might Be
gear: Old family ring that gets warm around magic
Tarnished page from a genealogy record he won’t read

advantages.name: Latent Pulse
advantages.description: Once per Job, your body instinctively reacts to a magical threat (e.g., glyph trap, Pattern warp). Ask the GM for a warning or roll a free Check to evade it—even if you didn’t see it coming.

advantages.name: Bloodline Echo
advantages.description: When near a powerful Pattern source, spend 1 Moxie to channel a fragment of inherited power. This gives you one magical Tag (GM’s choice: e.g., Resistant, Powerful, Glowing) for your next physical action.

advantages.name: Unmarked, Unmade
advantages.description: You cannot be permanently magically branded, marked, or geotagged. Any such effect wears off at the end of the Scene or is blocked entirely if you spend a Moxie point.

trademarks.name: Strong as an Ox
trademarks.description: Your strength is legendary. You lift what others cannot, break what seems unbreakable, and stand like a stone against any tide. But great brawn often brings great consequences.
gear: Thick leather bracers from a fallen foe

advantages.name: Mighty Heave
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to lift, shove, or hold something beyond normal human limits for one Scene. This includes bracing a collapsing structure, hurling a boulder, or carrying three wounded allies at once.

advantages.name: Iron Grip
advantages.description: When grappling or restraining an enemy, roll with Mastery.

advantages.name: Muscle Memory
advantages.description: Once per Scene, when you fail a physical Check, you may reroll if brute strength would plausibly help.

trademarks.name: Outcast
trademarks.description: You live apart from society’s walls — an outsider by blood, choice, or circumstance. Their rules are not yours, and their scorn is an old companion. Freedom tastes sweeter than acceptance ever could.
gear: A tattered cloak that blends with any crowd
Carved token of your tribe or people

advantages.name: Invisible Among Them
advantages.description: Roll with Mastery to avoid notice in crowds or populated spaces.

advantages.name: Hard Lessons
advantages.description: Once per Job, when suffering from prejudice or ostracism, gain 1 Moxie and advantage on your next Check.

advantages.name: The Outsider’s Insight
advantages.description: When observing someone for a few moments, ask the GM one question about their intent or hidden flaw and receive a truthful answer.

trademarks.name: Formidable Weaponmaster
trademarks.description: You and your weapon are one. Each strike is poetry, each parry a song of survival. You’ve fought long enough to know the weight of blood and the importance of balance.
gear: Well-crafted Weapon (choose one: sword, axe, spear, etc.)

advantages.name: Deadly Precision
advantages.description: Roll with Mastery when making a precision strike against a known foe or weak point.

advantages.name: Flow Like Water
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to deflect or negate one melee hit that would otherwise connect.

advantages.name: Weapon Savant
advantages.description: Once per Scene, declare you know a weakness in an opponent’s fighting style; you or an ally gain +1 Action Die on attacks against them for the Scene.

trademarks.name: Protect the Land
trademarks.description: The wind whispers secrets to you. The soil feeds your strength. You are kin to beasts and thorn alike, and those who harm the land will find no mercy under your watch.
flaws: Taken by Sorrow for a Blighted Land
gear: Necklace of teeth from beasts you’ve tamed

advantages.name: Beast’s Bond
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to call a nearby wild creature to aid you for a Scene. The animal acts with Loyalty (Grit 2).

advantages.name: Rooted in the Earth
advantages.description: Roll with Mastery when resisting movement, magical displacement, or intimidation while in natural terrain.

advantages.name: Wrath of the Wild
advantages.description: Once per Scene, unleash a primal roar or ritual that frightens enemies within Close range for 1 Turn.

trademarks.name: Bounty Hunter
trademarks.description: You hunt people for money — fugitives, deserters, war criminals, deadbeats, or the occasional innocent caught in the crossfire. You don’t ask questions unless they pay extra. You track your quarry across borders and badlands, through burned-out starports and borderworld bunkers. What matters is the bounty, the job, and getting out alive.

advantages.name: No Place to Hide
advantages.description: When you enter a new settlement or starport, you may ask the GM: “Where is my quarry likely to be?” The GM must answer with a clear lead or impression — even if it’s a trap.

advantages.name: Bring 'Em In Cold
advantages.description: When you successfully take down a target using force, and your goal was to capture, not kill, you may spend 1 Moxie to automatically restrain or subdue them — no further roll required.

advantages.name: Tracking Fob
advantages.description: You carry a personal fob or signature tracker keyed to your quarry. Once per job, spend a Moxie to reveal their general direction or recent location, even across star systems.

trademarks.name: Silver Tongue
trademarks.description: You talk like the credits are already yours. Some call it charisma, others call it lies — but whatever it is, it gets results. You can bluff your way into a fortress, out of a standoff, or through the hangar gates before anyone checks your ID.

advantages.name: Fast Talk
advantages.description: When you're under scrutiny or threat, you may roll with Mastery to buy yourself or an ally a few seconds of confusion or delay.

advantages.name: Flash the Badge
advantages.description: Spend a Moxie to impersonate authority convincingly enough to override routine checks, gain temporary access, or make someone hesitate.

advantages.name: The Long Con
advantages.description: When you lie to the same target over time (a Scene or longer), you may gain +1 Action Die on future social interactions until they catch on.

trademarks.name: Code of Honor
trademarks.description: You live by rules — your own. Maybe it’s a code passed down. Maybe it’s the last thing keeping you from becoming a monster. But it’s there. And it binds you tighter than most laws.

advantages.name: Oathbound
advantages.description: When you uphold your personal code at cost to yourself, gain +1 Moxie (once per Scene).

advantages.name: Not That Kind of Killer
advantages.description: Spend 1 Moxie to avoid killing someone in a lethal moment (redirect, disable, or hold back) — even if the hit would normally be fatal.

advantages.name: The Hard Choice
advantages.description: Once per Job, ask the GM to present a moral dilemma. If you follow your code instead of the easy way out, gain a Boon.
